    • errorOutputString

      private String errorOutputString
      A string variable that will store all the error outputs generated from the Inventory Class method, inputValidator. This variable is used during the saveProductHandler, where all user inputs are validated prior to saving the product. If any errors are caught, the contents of the errorOutPutString are displayed on the Add Product window in red text.

    • inventory

      private Inventory inventory
      Gets the current inventory to update with an added product.

    • getAssociatedPartsOfAddedProduct

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Part> getAssociatedPartsOfAddedProduct()

    • initialize

      public void initialize​(URL url, ResourceBundle rb)
      Sets the initial conditions of the Add Product scene. This method sets the ID field to disabled, with pre-populated text, "Auto-generated". In addition, it pre-populates the Parts table with current inventory of parts to add.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - Resolves the relative file path of the root object.
      rb - Localizes the root object.

    • searchPartHandler

      private void searchPartHandler​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Searches for and filters all Parts whose IDs or names match the string entered via user input. The method first determines whether the event source is from the addParts table or the associatedParts table, and thereby determines whether the search is carried out for the addParts or the associatedParts table. In either case, the search function checks if the search term is numeric or alphabetic; if numeric, the search function will filter results by Part ID; otherwise if search term is alphabetic, the search function filters results by Part Name. If no parts matching the search term are found, then an error will output accordingly. Finally, if the search term is blank, then the search will produce an unfiltered list of all parts.
      Parameters:
      event - An object generated by the ActionEvent that is triggered by the user entering a search input in either the Parts table or Associated Parts table.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • addAssociatedPartHandler

      private void addAssociatedPartHandler​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Adds a part that the user selects from the addParts table to the associatedParts table. FUTURE ENHANCEMENT: Adding an associated part should decrement the current stock of the part in inventory.
      Parameters:
      event - An object generated by the ActionEvent that is triggered by the user clicking the Add button.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • removeAssociatedPartHandler

      private void removeAssociatedPartHandler​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Removes a part that the user selects from the associatedPartsTable. FUTURE ENHANCEMENT: Removing an associated part should increment the current stock of the part in inventory.
      Parameters:
      event - An object generated by the ActionEvent that is triggered by the user clicking the Remove button.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • saveAddedProductHandler

      private void saveAddedProductHandler​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Saves the added product into the current inventory. The method will validate all entries in the form and output any applicable errors on the form in red text. Otherwise if no errors are found, then the method updates the current inventory with the added product.
      Parameters:
      event - An object generated by the ActionEvent that is triggered by the user clicking the Save button.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • cancelAddedProductHandler

      private void cancelAddedProductHandler​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Redirects user to the Main screen.
      Parameters:
      event - An object generated by the ActionEvent that is triggered by the user clicking the Cancel button.
      Throws:
      IOException
